fields.options: Leave Policy

(Revised -25 April 2023)

Our Leave Policy-designed and incorporate the following features:


  • It has version tracking information like effective date, revision number.
  • It is logically divided and has numbered sections.
  • It has the name of the policy written on each page.
  • It will be made available in Intra-net, also mobile-friendly soon.
  • It is a clear, straight forward language that is easy to understand.
  • It has keywords, which are well defined to ensure zero ambiguity.
  • It holds meaningful communication of our leave policy.
  • It will be reviewed and audited periodically once a year. (HR policies)

    • More than the types and number of leaves, the process of availing leaves determines the employees’ perception of how ‘friendly’ the leave policy is.

    Remember that a well-structured HR policy is also a tool to communicate the company’s values and expectations. Leave policy is not just about granting leaves; it is about helping employees to know about their entitlements and to make it easy for employees to avail them effectively.

    The ultimate measure of a good leave policy is the outcomes it produces happy and engaged employees who have decent work-life balance.


    Revision: NC/HR/LP/v4-25/04/2023

1.Employees should proceed on leave only after getting the applied leave duly sanctioned by the concerned H.O.D through the ERP system.

2.In the event of an emergency, he/she will be liable to inform the concerned authority within 24 hours, failing which he/she will be liable to refusal of leave or pay cuts without any further reference on the matter.

3.Employees are required to report on duty after the completion of the sanctioned leave positively. If leave is extended on emergency, then the employees should communicate and get an approval immediately mentioning the reason therewith and the period extended to the HOD.

4.The duty time is fixed in general from 9.00 am to 6.00 pm until further circular is published.

5.Employee reporting to the office after 09.30 is not acceptable in general if the reasons is genuine, the reporting person can take a decision. The same shall be applicable for early going as well, however in both case repetition will invite disciplinary action.

6.Sick leaves more than two days can only be accepted with the supporting documents / Medical Certificate from Doctor.

7.Casual leave permitted maximum 2 days in a month; anything above will be redeemed from the allocated earned leave if available, otherwise treated as LOP.

8.Availing leave either on a Friday or on a Monday is restricted to maximum 2 times in a quarter; if such leave pattern repeats unreasonably in the same period, then the weekend holidays will also be deducted from earned leave.


Revision: NC/HR/LP/v4-25/04/2023

The Earned leave is also known as Vacation Leave (VL) or Privilege Leave (PL) or Flexi Holiday, or Annual Leave (AL). The leave balance at the end of the year can be carried forward to the next year. Earned Leaves can also be converted to cash through a process called Leave Encashment at the time of full & final settlement.The basic salary is usually considered as the unit of exchange to encash leaves.
Item         Qty               Remarks
Leave Entitlement per year   12 Days    After 12 months of continous service for first year
Maximum EL/AL/PL that can be  24 Days

carried forward / Accumulation.

Foot Note:

✓ Earned leave must be applied at least 5 days ahead of the leave intend.

✓ The leave must be applied through ERP system only.

✓ If one avail earned leave before and after holidays, holidays/weekend will also be considered as earned leave.

✓ The earned leave can be accumulated upto 24 days, anything above must be used on or before 31st March of proceeding year, otherwise it may lapse and

NO ENCASHMENT allowed.
Casual Leaves accommodate any urgent/ unforeseen personal requirements as against EL being planned leaves.
Qty            Remarks

12 Days    12 Days (During his / her first 12 months and further continuous service)

Foot Note:

✓ Casual leaves limited to 2 Days continuously.

✓ The leave must be applied through ERP system only.

✓ The casual leave cannot be availed before & after holidays twice in a month

✓ The casual leave cannot be carried forward to next year.

Revision: NC/HR/LP/v4-25/04/2023
Sick leave also called Medical Leaves (ML), these are provided on the ground of sickness or in case of illness or medically unfit.
Qty              Remarks

12 Days    12 Days (During his/her first 12 months and further continuous service)

Foot Note:

✓ Medical certificate is mandatory in case of continuous sick leave more than 2 days.

✓ The medical certificate must be from a recognized medical doctor.

✓ The sick leave must be informed on the same day to the HR and reporting officer.

✓ If sick leave is taken before and after holidays, the holidays also will be considered as sick leave.

✓ The sick leave cannot be carried forward to the next year.

Maternity Benefit Act of 1961 requires that employers need to provide 180 days of paid leave to any woman who has completed their last one year preceding the expected delivery date. The Act also provides for mandated leave in case of miscarriage, adoption, surrogacy and tubectomy. The leave cannot be carried forward.
Qty                   Remarks

180 Days    Eligibility: Woman who had worked in our organization for a period of at least 180 days within the past 12 months.


Foot Note:

✓ The Maternity leave is applicable for the first two children only.

✓ In case of a third child, 12 weeks of leave can be availed without Pay.

Revision: NC/HR/LP/v3-15/12/2022
The Paternity Leave is a leave offered to expectant fathers after a child is born. It is a leave meant for the father to take care of the new-born and the mother.
Qty                Remarks

2 Days       It can be availed within Four weeks from the birth of new baby.

Foot Note:

✓ To be eligible for Paternity Leave you must be the biological / adoptive father of a child.

✓ The 2 days can be taken all at once.

Special leave for employees getting married called Marriage Leave. Marriage leave is not a legal entitlement, but it is given as a privilege. In case of remarriage or multiple marriages, employees will have to utilize their annual leave balances or even go on leave without pay.
Qty             Remarks

3 Days    The eligible employee who has completed their probation period

Foot Note:

✓ The eligibility is for only once in entire employment period with our organization.

✓ Marriage leave can be availed only for the first legal marriage of the employees.
If an employee asked to work on a weekend or a holiday due to the priority of the deliverables, they are offered a compensatory off on any other workday.
Qty              Remarks

As per the days worked    Comp-off lapses within 60 days.

Foot Note:

✓ The employee must claim comp-off after having worked on a non-working day.

✓ The request must be approved by the immediate manager and then forwarded to HR for granting a comp-off leave to the employee.

✓ The employee must utilize available comp-off leave within tits expiry.

There are cases when an employee has exhausted all leave balance but still requires time-off for meeting some exigency. In such situations, Management allows them to go on leave without pay (LWP). Since there is a loss of income it is called LOP Leave.

Any leave availed in violation of leave policy is also considered as LOP. For example, an employee going on vacation without prior intimation or approval. Or an employee not providing medical certificates in case of sick leave as per policy.

The deduction LOP will be done during the payroll of the month.

The permitted leave during the 6 months’ probation is 6 days (casual leave-3/ sick leave-3), otherwise LOP can be applied with prior approval.

All Paid Trainees are permitted One day leave in a month, otherwise LOP can be applied with prior approval.



Global Manager- HR
